bibl.title: Revolt Egyptian Style. Internal Opposition to Ptolemaic Rule.
bibl.note: Provides a context for the publication of a new Dublin papyrus which concerns the revolt of the Pharaoh Chaonnophris. - I. Ptolemy III Euergetes. 245 BC. - II. Ptolemy IV Philopator. Raphia (217) and after. - III. Ptolemy V Epiphanes: Lower Egypt (197/185). - IV. Ptolemy IV Philopator / Ptolemy V Epiphanes: the Revolt of Haronnophris and Chaonnophris in the Thebaid (206-186). - V. Ptolemy VI Philometor, Ptolemy VIII Euergetes II, Cleopatra II: Dionysius Petosarapis and the Thebaid (ca. 165). - VI. Ptolemy VIII Euergetes II: Harsiesis 131-130. - VII. Ptolemy Soter II. The Thebaid 88-86 (?). - P. Dublin Inv. TCD Pap. Gr. 274. Official correspondence Concerning the Revolt of Chaonnophris. Lycopolis. ca. 190 BC. - Bibliography.

bibl.idno: P. Dublin Inv. TCD Pap. Gr. 274

bibl.note: McGING Brian C., Revolt Egyptian Style. Internal Opposition to Ptolemaic Rule.
141.4 P. Dublin Inv. TCD Pap. Gr. 274
